{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Social Media Manager",
  "description": "Dovers Dental Clinic - We utilise the finest resources, skills, and innovations to bring out your best smile and overall health in the most relaxing and creative atmosphere!

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Create and implement content strategies for daily/weekly posts across all platforms
	Monitor and respond to DMs, comments, and online inquiries timely
	Create monthly content calendars, campaign plans, and performance reports
	Collaborate with the design and clinical team to produce branded graphics, videos, and educational posts
	Promote clinic services, offers, and events through sponsored ads and influencer outreach
	Analyze engagement metrics to improve reach and customer conversion
	Maintain a consistent tone, branding, and visual identity across platforms.


Requirements


	Proven experience managing business social media pages (Instagram, Facebook, TikTok, LinkedIn)
	Proficiency in Canva, content planning tools, and Meta Business Suite
	Strong copywriting and customer engagement.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;clinic@doversdental.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-22",
  "validThrough": "2025-10-23",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Dovers Dental Clinic"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "187700"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Social Media Manager Job at Dovers Dental Clinic




        
    

        
        Dovers Dental Clinic - We utilise the finest resources, skills, and innovations to bring out your best smile and overall health in the most relaxing and creative atmosphere!

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Create and implement content strategies for daily/weekly posts across all platforms
	Monitor and respond to DMs, comments, and online inquiries timely
	Create monthly content calendars, campaign plans, and performance reports
	Collaborate with the design and clinical team to produce branded graphics, videos, and educational posts
	Promote clinic services, offers, and events through sponsored ads and influencer outreach
	Analyze engagement metrics to improve reach and customer conversion
	Maintain a consistent tone, branding, and visual identity across platforms.


Requirements


	Proven experience managing business social media pages (Instagram, Facebook, TikTok, LinkedIn)
	Proficiency in Canva, content planning tools, and Meta Business Suite
	Strong copywriting and customer engagement.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: clinic@doversdental.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "description": "Outcess Solutions Nigeria Limited&nbsp;is an outcessing company that provide digital Services to different clients in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Care Executive
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	As a Customer Care Executive, you will be the frontline representative for our company, interacting with customers to provide information, resolve complaints, and address inquiries related to our products or services.
	The ideal candidate should have excellent communication skills, problem-solving abilities, and a customer-first mindset.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;Annastasia.Onuorah@outcess.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Customer Care Executive Job at Outcess Solutions Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Outcess Solutions Nigeria Limited is an outcessing company that provide digital Services to different clients in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Care Executive
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	As a Customer Care Executive, you will be the frontline representative for our company, interacting with customers to provide information, resolve complaints, and address inquiries related to our products or services.
	The ideal candidate should have excellent communication skills, problem-solving abilities, and a customer-first mindset.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: Annastasia.Onuorah@outcess.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Front Desk Officer",
  "description": "JOJE Hospital, Abuja is one of the fastest growing medical facility located in the city of Abuja, committed to providing excellent and first class medical services to it&rsquo;s clients at an affordable price.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Listen to customers&#39; questions and concerns
	Provide answers and response to clients&#39; questions
	Provide information about services to clients
	Keep the front deskd environments clean always
	Keep records


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor&#39;s Degree or HND qualification with 1-2 years of experience.


Salary
N70,000 - N80,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;Info@jojehospital.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Front Desk Officer Job at JOJE Hospital




        
    

        
        JOJE Hospital, Abuja is one of the fastest growing medical facility located in the city of Abuja, committed to providing excellent and first class medical services to it’s clients at an affordable price.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Officer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Listen to customers' questions and concerns
	Provide answers and response to clients' questions
	Provide information about services to clients
	Keep the front deskd environments clean always
	Keep records


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree or HND qualification with 1-2 years of experience.


Salary
N70,000 - N80,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: Info@jojehospital.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Assistant Operations Officer",
  "description": "Courier &amp; Logistics Management Institute (CLMI) - Your Gateway to Premier Education and Professional Development. The Ultimate Platform to Launch and Sell Your Courses Online, Equipped with Comprehensive eCommerce Features.

At CLMI, we offer an unparalleled LMS platform where you can sell courses and gain professional insights into courier, logistics, transport, and management. As the world&rsquo;s only professional body offering all four categories together, we provide knowledge from global experts and industry leaders. Elevate your educational and professional standing in society with CLMI.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Operations Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Ogudu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive&nbsp;Assistant Operations Officer&nbsp;to support the smooth day-to-day running of CLMI&rsquo;s training, events, and membership operations.
	The ideal candidate will be organized, efficient, and able to manage multiple tasks while working closely with the operations team.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist in planning, coordination, and execution of training programs, workshops, and conferences.
	Maintain accurate records of participants, members, and program schedules.
	Handle basic administrative duties such as correspondence, documentation, and filing.
	Liaise with vendors, facilitators, and service providers as directed.
	Support logistics for events including venue setup, attendee management, and materials preparation.
	Provide timely reports to the Operations Manager.
	Ensure smooth internal processes and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an OND / HND / B.Sc. in Business Administration, Management, or a related field.
	2&ndash;3 years of experience in operations, admin, or event coordination is an advantage.
	Strong organizational and multitasking skills.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
	Must reside in&nbsp;Ogudu or nearby environs&nbsp;(strict requirement).


What We Offer


	Opportunity to grow in a professional, impact-driven institute.
	Exposure to high-level business and logistics leaders.
	A supportive and collaborative work environment.
	Competitive entry-level salary with commission on any sale made.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to:&nbsp;simon_emeje@yahoo.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Assistant Operations Officer Job at Courier and Logistics Management Institute (CLMI)




        
    

        
        Courier & Logistics Management Institute (CLMI) - Your Gateway to Premier Education and Professional Development. The Ultimate Platform to Launch and Sell Your Courses Online, Equipped with Comprehensive eCommerce Features.

At CLMI, we offer an unparalleled LMS platform where you can sell courses and gain professional insights into courier, logistics, transport, and management. As the world’s only professional body offering all four categories together, we provide knowledge from global experts and industry leaders. Elevate your educational and professional standing in society with CLMI.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Operations Officer
     

            
    



Job Location: Ogudu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Assistant Operations Officer to support the smooth day-to-day running of CLMI’s training, events, and membership operations.
	The ideal candidate will be organized, efficient, and able to manage multiple tasks while working closely with the operations team.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist in planning, coordination, and execution of training programs, workshops, and conferences.
	Maintain accurate records of participants, members, and program schedules.
	Handle basic administrative duties such as correspondence, documentation, and filing.
	Liaise with vendors, facilitators, and service providers as directed.
	Support logistics for events including venue setup, attendee management, and materials preparation.
	Provide timely reports to the Operations Manager.
	Ensure smooth internal processes and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an OND / HND / B.Sc. in Business Administration, Management, or a related field.
	2–3 years of experience in operations, admin, or event coordination is an advantage.
	Strong organizational and multitasking skills.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
	Must reside in Ogudu or nearby environs (strict requirement).


What We Offer


	Opportunity to grow in a professional, impact-driven institute.
	Exposure to high-level business and logistics leaders.
	A supportive and collaborative work environment.
	Competitive entry-level salary with commission on any sale made.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: simon_emeje@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Loan Recovery Officer",
  "description": "Fort Knox Outsourcing was set up to cater to the growing need of businesses in Nigeria to reap the economic, strategic and operational benefits offered by outsourcing. We act as a &ldquo;Third Party Service Provider&rdquo; that Source, Select, and Second employment ready workforce in line with client specifications to meet their talent needs as quickly as possible!

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Loan Recovery Officer

Job Locations:&nbsp;Ikeja and Aja - Lagos and Ibadan - Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Onboard Viable Merchants on the Business Platform.
	Evaluate credit worthiness of Merchants
	Physically verify Merchants Location and business financial health for loan consideration.
	Interview Merchants to determine their financial eligibility and feasibility
	Support merchants with questions they might have.
	Justify decisions (approvals/rejections) and report on them
	Maintain an active knowledge base of all of the organization&rsquo;s loan products and an understanding of the qualifications required of each Merchant.
	Build long term, trusting relationships with customers
	Grow and achieve loan portfolio targets for merchants.


Qualifications &amp; Skills


	A First Degree BSc&nbsp;HND
	1 year of Minimum relevant work experience in a Microfinance Banks
	Excellent knowledge of loan application procedures.
	Socially and emotionally aware.
	Must have a Smartphone.
	Strong communication skills and proven customer service experience.
	Exceptional analytical skills and the ability to work with complicated financial data.
	Demonstrable knowledge of credit risk analysis.


Salary and Benefits


	N100,000 - N160,000 monthly.
	Airtime and Data Allowance , Monthly KPI Bonus, HMO.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@fortknoxoutsourcing.com&nbsp;using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2025-10-31",

  },

Loan Recovery Officer Job at Fort Knox Outsourcing




        
    

        
        Fort Knox Outsourcing was set up to cater to the growing need of businesses in Nigeria to reap the economic, strategic and operational benefits offered by outsourcing. We act as a “Third Party Service Provider” that Source, Select, and Second employment ready workforce in line with client specifications to meet their talent needs as quickly as possible!

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Loan Recovery Officer

Job Locations: Ikeja and Aja - Lagos and Ibadan - Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Onboard Viable Merchants on the Business Platform.
	Evaluate credit worthiness of Merchants
	Physically verify Merchants Location and business financial health for loan consideration.
	Interview Merchants to determine their financial eligibility and feasibility
	Support merchants with questions they might have.
	Justify decisions (approvals/rejections) and report on them
	Maintain an active knowledge base of all of the organization’s loan products and an understanding of the qualifications required of each Merchant.
	Build long term, trusting relationships with customers
	Grow and achieve loan portfolio targets for merchants.


Qualifications & Skills


	A First Degree BSc HND
	1 year of Minimum relevant work experience in a Microfinance Banks
	Excellent knowledge of loan application procedures.
	Socially and emotionally aware.
	Must have a Smartphone.
	Strong communication skills and proven customer service experience.
	Exceptional analytical skills and the ability to work with complicated financial data.
	Demonstrable knowledge of credit risk analysis.


Salary and Benefits


	N100,000 - N160,000 monthly.
	Airtime and Data Allowance , Monthly KPI Bonus, HMO.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@fortknoxoutsourcing.com using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply
